text: In Greek mythology, Ialmenus or Ialmenos (Ancient Greek: Ἰάλμενος) was a son of Ares and Astyoche, and twin brother of Ascalaphus. Together with his brother, he sailed with the Argonauts, was among the suitors of HelenBibliotheca 1. 9. 16. & 3\. 10. 8 and led the Orchomenian contingent in the Trojan War.Homer, Iliad, 2. 512 ffPausanias, Description of Greece, 9. 37. 7 Unlike Ascalaphus, Ialmenus survived the war. He was said to have ended up in Colchis, where he founded a colony, the inhabitants of which were later referred to as the "Achaeans of Pontus".Strabo, Geography, 9. 2. 42 == See also == * 21602 Ialmenus, Jovian asteroid == References == Category:Children of Ares Category:Argonauts Category:Achaean Leaders
title: Ialmenus
